name: Hardest A General Brainbuster Trivia Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: Here is a classic riddle: A man is found freshly dead in the middle of a vast desert.  There are absolutely no tracks or markings of any kind surrounding his body. What "P" item is found on his back?
questions.explanation:
parachute.

	The man attempted to jump from a plane but his parachute malfunctioned, hence he hit the ground with an impact that made him lose his life.

questions.text: Which of these drugs reverses the effects of the drug Ativan?
questions.explanation:
Romazicon.

	Ativan is also known as Lorazepam, a sedative.  Romazicon, aka Flumazenil, is an antagonistic drug to benzodiazipenes such as Ativan.

questions.text: From which musical do the following lyrics come: 'He left River City the library building, but left all the books to her'?
questions.explanation:
Music Man.

	Meredith Willson and Franklin Lacey wrote this play which features the character Professor Harold Hill, the character described in the quote.

questions.text: What class of bacteria emits methane and natural gas?
questions.explanation:
Archaea.

	The name 'archaea' literally means 'primitive', and the archaebacteria are among the most primitive creatures in the phylum Monera.  They live in extreme environments, such as the stomachs of ruminants.

questions.text: Also the name of a lizard that appears to have a head at each end,  what is this 2-headed serpent of Greek myth called?
questions.explanation:
Amphisbaena.

	The name amphisbaena (or amphisbaina) means 'go both ways' in Greek.

questions.text: The dessert called a 'charlotte' is a variety of what popular sweet treat?
questions.explanation:
Pudding.

	A charlotte pudding has stewed fruit covered with a bread or sponge casing.

questions.text: Who made a series of very important Bible translations in England during the late 14th century?
questions.explanation:
Wyclif.

	John Wyclif and his Bibles helped transform England religiously.  It was an impetus of the anti-Catholic Lollard movement.

questions.text: An undulipodia is another name for which cell organelle?
questions.explanation:
Flagellum.

	An undulipodia is a flagellum (whip-like structure used in movement) found in eukaryotic organisms.

questions.text: What was Philip Yancey's last and best word in the English language?
questions.explanation:
Grace.

	Philip Yancey is the best-selling author of all time.  One of his books is titled 'What's So Amazing About Grace?'

questions.text: Another name for which of these birds is 'whaup'?
questions.explanation:
Curlew.

	Other species of curlew include the whimbrel, Eskimo curlew and stone curlew (or thick-knee). Thanks for playing.
